attributes.action: introduce a law - those who pull out of buying your property are made to pay costs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: When a party confirms they wish to buy your property, but two weeks before the move (& before anything is signed), they pull out for their own personal reasons, you're left with huge costs. In France, the 'Contrat Preliminaire de Vente' is a preliminary contract, and legally binding. If you do not go ahead with the purchase you will face further action from the seller. There should be a similar law here in the UK, which protects those who lose out.

rejection.details:
